metadata.title: CVE-2020-10018 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
WebKitGTK through 2.26.4 and WPE WebKit through 2.26.4 (which are the versions right before 2.28.0) contains a memory corruption issue (use-after-free) that may lead to arbitrary code execution. This issue has been fixed in 2.28.0 with improved memory handling.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.28.0-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.28.0-1ubuntu2').
